unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Margin of Error When Given an Interval: Airline Flight
question_text:
A $99\%$ confidence interval for the proportion of people who don't show up for their airline flights is $(.022,.076)$.
Using this data, what is the margin of error for the proportion of people who don't show up for their flights?
solution:
The margin of error represents the length of the point estimate to one of the endpoints of the interval. To put it in simpler terms, it is half the length of the interval.

To find the margin of error in this case, use the following:

$$\frac { 0.076-.022 }{ 2 } =0.027$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'B' is incorrect as $0.049$ is the value for the point estimate. Choice 'C' is incorrect as $0.054$ is the range of the interval. Choice 'D' is incorrect as the endpoints of the interval were just added together.
